intro: Echium simsii, commonly known as the Canary Island thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces a tall, spiny stem with lance-shaped leaves and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Echium simsii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
